conclusion: Object A (blue object) casts a shadow towards the bottom right.
Object B (orange object) casts a shadow towards the bottom right.
Object C (black object) casts a shadow towards the bottom right.
Object D (white object) casts a shadow towards the bottom right.
The shadows cast towards the bottom right indicate that the light source is positioned towards the top left of the scene.
Moving the light source to the back left will cause the shadows to shift direction towards the front right.
Moving the light source to the back right will cause the shadows to shift direction towards the front left.
When the light source moves to the back left, shadow A will move towards the front right.
When the light source moves to the back left, shadow B will move towards the front right.
When the light source moves to the back left, shadow C will move towards the front right.
When the light source moves to the back left, shadow D will move towards the front right.
The size of the shadows may increase due to the angle of the light source when it moves to the back left.
When the light source moves to the back right, shadow A will move towards the front left.
When the light source moves to the back right, shadow B will move towards the front left.
When the light source moves to the back right, shadow C will move towards the front left.
When the light source moves to the back right, shadow D will move towards the front left.
The size of the shadows may increase due to the angle of the light source when it moves to the back right.
When the light source moves to the back left, shadows A, B, C, and D will shift towards the front right and may increase in size.
When the light source moves to the back right, shadows A, B, C, and D will shift towards the front left and may increase in size.
